{{about|the GUI system for crafting|the item|Knowledge Book}}
[[File:Crafting Recipe Book (inventory).png|thumb|right|350px|The crafting recipe book, as it appears in the [[Java Edition|Java]] [[Survival]] inventory screen.]]
The '''recipe book''' is a mechanic in ''[[Minecraft]]'' that serves as a catalog of [[Crafting#Complete recipe list|recipes]] and as a crafting, smelting, and banner patterning guide.

== Interface ==
=== Java Edition ===
The recipe book can be displayed in [[inventory]], [[crafting table]], [[furnace]], [[blast furnace]] and [[smoker]]. The player must enter the GUI and press the [[knowledge book]] icon; the recipe book then opens to the left.

Recipes are stored in several different tabs:

;Crafting Table and Inventory
*{{InvSprite|Compass|scale=0.5}} - the first, topmost tab contains every unlocked recipe.
*{{InvSprite|Iron Axe|scale=0.5}} - the second tab contains utility items, [[tool]]s, [[weapon]]s and [[armor]].
*{{InvSprite|Bricks|scale=0.5}} - the third tab contains building materials.
*{{InvSprite|Lava Bucket|scale=0.5}} - the fourth tab contains [[food]], ingredients, and miscellaneous things.
*{{InvSprite|Redstone Dust|scale=0.5}} - the fifth tab contains [[redstone]] materials.

;Furnace
*{{InvSprite|Compass|scale=0.5}} - the first, topmost tab contains every unlocked recipe.
*{{InvSprite|Raw Porkchop|scale=0.5}} - the second tab contains [[food]] items.
*{{InvSprite|Stone|scale=0.5}} - the third tab contains building and decorative materials.
*{{InvSprite|Lava Bucket|scale=0.5}} - the fourth tab contains miscellaneous things.

;Blast Furnace
*{{InvSprite|Compass|scale=0.5}} - the first, topmost tab contains every unlocked recipe.
*{{InvSprite|Redstone Ore|scale=0.5}} - the second tab contains the smelting recipe for [[Redstone Ore]].<ref>[[bugtracker:MC-144900|MC-144900]]</ref>
*{{InvSprite|Iron Shovel|scale=0.5}} - the third tab contains smelted [[ore]]s and recipes for recycling iron, gold, and chainmail gear.

;Smoker
*{{InvSprite|Compass|scale=0.5}} - the first, topmost tab contains every unlocked recipe.
*{{InvSprite|Raw Porkchop|scale=0.5}} - the second tab contains [[food]] items.

[[File:RecipeBookRightClick.png|thumb|right|350px|{{control|Interacting}} an item in the recipe book shows all the patterns.]]

Clicking on an item in the list displays its recipe in the grid. The item can then be crafted if the materials are available; otherwise, the button containing the item is highlighted red. Each click shows alternate patterns for the same crafting recipe, if there are several patterns (for example, each click on a [[banner]] crafting recipe shows all the possible banners using different colored [[wool]]s). Right-click on the item shows all the alternate patterns.

Shift-clicking an item in the list puts all available materials in the crafting grid.

The button in the top right corner of the recipe book toggles between "Show all" and "Show craftable"; the latter displays only recipes for which the player has the necessary materials in their inventory. The top-left corner also contains a search bar to further narrow the list.

There are also recipes for [[campfire]]s and [[stonecutter]]s, but they don't have a recipe book interface.

Tabs for specific categories can be hidden from the recipe book if there are no known recipes for that particular tab, but the search tab is always visible even if there are no known recipes.

=== Bedrock Edition ===
Unlike {{el|je}}, the recipe book can be displayed only in the [[inventory]] and [[crafting table]] in [[Survival]] mode. The player must enter the GUI and click on the recipe book tab.

Recipes are stored in several different tabs. The tabs contain matching items from each tab of the [[Creative inventory#Bedrock Edition|Creative inventory]], so an item found in a particular tab in Creative can be found in its equivalent tab in the recipe book, should it have a recipe.

The tabs are as follows:
*{{InvSprite|Bricks|scale=0.5|text='''Construction'''}} - contains building materials.
*{{InvSprite|Diamond Sword|scale=0.5|text='''Equipment'''}} - contains tools, weapons, and armor.
*{{InvSprite|Red Bed|scale=0.5|text='''Items'''}} - contains [[ore]] items and miscellaneous things.
*{{InvSprite|Grass Block|scale=0.5|text='''Nature'''}} - contains nature-related materials and food.
*{{InvSprite|Compass|scale=0.5|text='''All'''}} - contains every unlocked recipe.

Clicking on an item in the list puts all available materials in the crafting grid, displaying the recipe. The item can then be crafted if the materials are available; otherwise, the button containing the item is highlighted red. Right-click on the item automatically crafts it, and pressing {{key|shift}} crafts all items based on how many materials the player have in the inventory.

The button in the top right corner of the recipe book toggles between "All" and "Craftable"; the latter displays only recipes for which the player has the necessary materials in their inventory. The top-left corner also contains a search bar to further narrow the list.

== Unlocking ==
{{Rewrite|furnace/smoker/blast furnace/campfire recipes; bedrock "unlock" system|section=1}}
{{update|section=1|The lists - update to [[The Copper Age]]}}
[[File:NewRecipesUnlocked.gif|thumb|320px|The [[toasts|toast]] that pops up when new recipes are unlocked.|alt=]]

The player must unlock recipes before using them in the recipe book. Recipes are unlocked upon meeting certain criteria; while for most recipes, one must hold a specific item, there are a few exceptions (for instance, boats are unlocked by touching water, whereas chests are unlocked after filling ten inventory slots). Once a recipe has been unlocked, the player is alerted of it via a notification that appears in the top right-hand corner of the screen, and the recipe becomes accessible through its relevant interface (inventory, crafting table, furnace, et cetera).

By default, the player does not need the recipes to craft a specific item; if they know a recipe without it being unlocked, they can insert the required items into the interface manually. However, if {{Cd|[https://minecraft.wiki/w/Game_rule#List_of_game_rules doLimitedCrafting]}} is set to {{Cd|true}}, a recipe must be unlocked in order to craft a specific item at all.

Recipes can be granted or retracted by force, either through use of the {{cmd|recipe}} command or a [[knowledge book]]. 

In ''[[Bedrock Edition]]'', if {{Cd|[https://minecraft.wiki/w/Game_rule#List_of_game_rules recipesUnlock]}} is set to {{Cd|false}} while creating a world, the player can view all recipes.

== History ==
=== Development ===
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine||October 30, 2015|link=https://www.twitch.tv/videos/19541608?t=31m50s|Developers discussed the possibility of a recipe book during a [[Pocket Edition]]/[[Windows 10 Edition]] Q&A livestream.}}
|{{HistoryLine||September 25, 2016|link={{ytl|ILG2fSzunJ0|t=18m50s}}|At [[MINECON 2016]], [[Tommaso Checchi]] explained the need for a recipe book while discussing the unification of the desktop and pocket platforms.}}
|{{HistoryLine||March 23, 2017|link={{tweet|MiaLem_n|847377173270757378}}|[[Maria Lemón]] revealed the new recipe book feature.}}
}}

=== ''Java Edition'' ===
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.12|dev=17w13a|Added the recipe book.
|The recipe book in the [[crafting table]] contains five tabs. Tabs for specific categories are hidden if there are no known recipes for that tab, except the search tab, which is always visible.
* The first tab contains all craftable items.
* The second tab contains all craftable items that are found in the ''Tools'' and ''Combat'' tab in Creative.
* The third tab contains all craftable items within the ''Building Blocks'' tab in Creative.
* The fourth tab contains all craftable items found in the ''Decorations'', ''Transportation'', ''Miscellaneous'', ''Food'', and ''Brewing'' tabs in Creative.
* The fifth tab contains all craftable items within the ''Redstone'' tab in Creative.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w14a|Changed the icon on the trigger button from a standard [[book]] to a [[knowledge book]].
|Added a shift-click ability to the recipe book that puts all available materials in the crafting grid.
|Added a new pop-up notification that appears when new recipes are unlocked.
|Added an easter egg that appears when searching for "excitedze" within the recipe book.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w15a|The icon in the pop-up notification now quickly cycles through all recipes that were unlocked.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w17a|Optimized the recipe book.
|Added the <code>toBeDisplayed</code> NBT tag, which stores recipe names that the player has unlocked, but not viewed in the crafting helper yet (used for the animation for new recipes).}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w18a|Optimized recipe book, fixing several issues with the "Show craftable" option.
|The word that triggers the easter egg is now "excitedze" rather than "excited".}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre1|Further optimizations to the recipe book.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre3|Optimized recipe searching.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre6|Further optimizations to searching, especially while using mods.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev={{tooltip|release|Changed between the last pre-release and the full release}}|slink=none|Added sliding sounds for the notification that appears when recipes are unlocked.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.13|dev=18w06a|Recipe book icon now is a separate file, it's stored in the recipe_button.png.
|Added a recipe book for the furnace.
* The first tab contains all smeltable items.
* The second tab contains all smeltable items that can be eaten.
* The third tab contains all smeltable items that can be placed as a block.
* The fourth tab contains all smeltable items that are inedible and cannot be placed as a block.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.16|dev=20w09a|[[Stained glass pane]] recipes now unlock only when the player has the same color of stained glass in their inventory.}}
